The Elder Sālapupphiya’s Birth Story
“In the city of Aruṇavatī,
I was a flower-seller then;
As I was going out through the gate,
I saw the Victor, the One with the Crest.🔽I offered a Sāla flower

analyzed: buddhassa pattam paggayha  sāla puppham adāsaha
translated: to the Buddha’s bowl;
To the Buddha who was on the right path,
with a serene mind.
In the twenty-ninth eon from now,
the flower I offered then;
I do not remember any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the Sāla flower.
In the fourteenth eon from now,
I was the one with immeasurable glory;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful universal monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Sālapupphiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sālapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Sālapupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
